questions.question_text:
During a network outage, a network administrator used the Cisco SD-WAN vManage Troubleshooting Dashboard APIs to troubleshoot the cause of the issue.
Which detail is captured during troubleshooting with these APIs?

discussion.content:
seems like an outdated question. The current API documentation does not reference any of the options.

https://developer.cisco.com/docs/sdwan/#!sd-wan-vmanage-v20-6

Selected Answer: C
Agree with NoobChampion, the question seems outdated and I can't find anything online to see what the correct answer would've been at the time. I'm inclined to stick with the provided answer of C and hope for the best

questions.answer_description: The double-quotations are a necessary syntax of Python. And for the json portion doesnt use parentheses. It always uses brackets. d[ג€dataג€][0][ג€host-nameג€] is the only logical answer.

discussion.content:
Page adds odd characters, to be clear it should be
d["data"][0]["host-name"]

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A Python script has been created that calls the Cisco SD-WAN vManage Device Inventory API to get the list of vEdges. The JSON data that returns to a Python dictionary has been converted and assigned to a variable named `d`. A portion of the JSON is shown in the exhibit. Which code will complete the expression hostname= to access the hostname?

discussion.content: 1234567J is right "bfd/history?" is correct, as you can see here: https://developer.cisco.com/docs/sdwan/#!device-realtime-monitoring/bfd

complete path is - https://{vmanage-ip-address}/dataservice/device/bfd/history?deviceId=deviceId
so the answer is "bfd/history?
https://developer.cisco.com/docs/sdwan/#!device-realtime-monitoring/bfd

Selected Answer: B
There are typos here the question is to deactivate but the answers are all active assuming the question is to activate the correct answer is B and also there is no s.port i think this is s.post

to deactivate, just replace active with deactivate

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B
See how %s is used in Python to replace a string
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54394758/python-s-f-d-etc

I am not aware of method port in request library. I think it is answer D 
import json, requests
payload = {'command': 'summary'}
r = requests.post('http://localhost:4028', data=json.dumps(payload))

B is also correct: 
s.port("https://vmanage:8443/dataservice/template/policy/vsmart/activate/%s%) , without the "policy_id"

B is the correct answer.
Source: https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/inputoutput.html#old-string-formatting

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A Python script must be created to deactivate vSmart Policy Cisco SD-WAN vManage Configuration APIs. The documentation states the URL is as shown in the exhibit for this REST call using POST, and that `policyId` is a required request parameter. Which line of Python code makes this call, assuming the variable `s` is a valid Requests session object and the variable `policy-id` is the policyId?
What is a capability of Cisco SD-WAN vManage Certificate Management API?

choices.B: distributes the root certificate to client devices

discussion.content:
I think is D.
Explanation:
You can either:
"Force sync root certificate" POST /certificate/forcesync/rootCert
"Generate CSR (Certificate Signing Request)" POST /certificate/generate/csr

I think D is more close than B. 

For the remaining questions. I found nothing: 
-related with SSL/TSL certificates
-related to delete installed certificates. (just invalidate devices) DELETE /certificate/{uuid} 
Source: https://developer.cisco.com/docs/sdwan/#!sd-wan-vmanage-v20-6 
Certificate Management -Device section.
